citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
A male Boston terrier puppy (DOB 10/6/24, Dam 009); was seen reluctant to bear weight on his right hind leg at the time
of inspection (afternoon of 11/15/2024). The leg had a small scab on the lower portion, the puppy did not show any signs
of pain when touching/moving any part of the affected leg, and no signs of swelling were observed. Inspector found this
condition had been reported to the licensee by a caretaker late on 11/14/2024, however the licensee said it had not been
communicated to the AV prior to the inspection. Lack of prompt communication with the AV doesn't ensure that an
animals' condition gets appropriate treatment. Adequate daily observations of animals' conditions must include prompt
communication with the attending veterinarian on abnormal conditions. Ensure that abnormal observations are promptly
reported to the attending veterinarian for evaluation so that an adequate treatment program can be started.
***To be corrected from 11/18/2024 forward.
Note: Licensee contacted the AV on 11/15/2024 and AV evaluated the affected puppy and initiated an appropriate
treatment plan before the end of the day.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(3) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
A male Boston terrier puppy (DOB 10/6/24, Dam 009); was seen reluctant to bear weight on his right hind leg at the time 
of inspection (afternoon of 11/15/2024). The leg had a small scab on the lower portion, the puppy did not show any signs 
of pain when touching/moving any part of the affected leg, and no signs of swelling were observed. Inspector found this 
condition had been reported to the licensee by a caretaker late on 11/14/2024, however the licensee said it had not been 
communicated to the AV prior to the inspection. Lack of prompt communication with the AV doesn't ensure that an 
animals' condition gets appropriate treatment. Adequate daily observations of animals' conditions must include prompt 
communication with the attending veterinarian on abnormal conditions. Ensure that abnormal observations are promptly 
reported to the attending veterinarian for evaluation so that an adequate treatment program can be started. 
***To be corrected from 11/18/2024 forward.  
Note: Licensee contacted the AV on 11/15/2024 and AV evaluated the affected puppy and initiated an appropriate 
treatment plan before the end of the day. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative. 
 
 n
